ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: SMART has worked extensively in conflict and disaster impacted regions, including regions impacted by the Tsunami and Earthquake. It has worked with the police forces and their familyâ€™s post 26/11 in Mumbai. SMART also worked in Tamil Nadu post Tsunami on a rehabilitation program in 24 villages that were badly impacted by the Tsunami. The NGO looked at different ways of empowering the women. Since 2013, SMART has been working in the conflict zone of Kashmir. It has launched Mothers Schools for the women whose families are impacted by insurgency. Building on their capacities and self esteem, the Mothers Schools have been very well received by the communities.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: 1. To increase the literary rate of women. 2. To facilitate and support community development programmer for economic development & self employment opportunities. 3. To develop gender balanced strategies and implement them accordingly. 4. To mobilize resource for the benefit of the community with likeminded partner and by public cooperation. 5. To raise awareness among, people for rights health good governance Environment etc. 1. National Festival Program The organization has done various cultural on occasion of 15th August, 26th January, 2nd October and guided the children for their bright future and improve themselves for their living standard. 2. Vocational and Handicraft Training Programme Keeping in mind the objective of removal of poverty by reducing the problem of employment of the Society has been instrumental in taking various concrete steps in the direction of removal of poverty. Society has started a Vocational Training Programme. In this training programme Women and Youths are provided training in different field like Computer, knitting and Tailoring. Chikan Embroidery, Type and Shorthand, Food Processing, Fashion Designing etc by experienced trainers. In this center trainees are programmers is to make the trainees so skilled that they may become self dependent and stand on their feet. Training center also motivates unemployed youths to start their own vocation. For this purpose training and counseling is provided to such persons. All information regarding these self employment activities is provided to people intending to start their own and to get freedom from unemployment. 3. Familly Planning Awareness Camp The population of our country surpassed 100 crores. The over population eats into all the development processes. Lack of resources, food, water, jobs, health care facilities, schools, colleges and thousands of other problems owe their origins to this over population. The awareness about the benefit of having a very small family is still very low in our country particularly in the areas of the Eastern Uttar Pradesh where the population density is disproportionately high. Considering very high level of reluctance of part of the villagers to adapt the family planning methods the population explosion has taken place causing deterioration in the available sources like Food, Education, Housing Employment opportunities etc.

Self help Group (SHGs) are small group of poor people. The members of an SHG face similar problems. They help each other, to solve their problems. SHGs promote small saving among their members. The savings are kept with the bank. This is common fund in the name of the SHG. The SHG gives small loans to its members in the name of common fund. The ideal size of an SHG is 10 to 20 members. A reasonably educated and helpful local person has to initially help the poor people to form groups. He or She

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
sourceOfFunds.purpose: Marking the first anniversary of the companies act, Sharp developments - a registered NGO since 1993 working in the area of energy; environment and education, organized the second national conference on Green energy based CSR interventions. The Conference offered a unique platform to adopt and promote Renewable Energy (RE) based CSR Interventions.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
sourceOfFunds.purpose: The objective of this one day conference was to arrive at a strategy for promotion of renewable energy and energy efficiency interventions in the existing buildings and what can be construed as retrofitting. Retrofitting an existing building can often be more cost effective than building a new facility. Case Studies to demonstrate building retrofit models, best practices, techniques involved and benefits and constraints were showcased.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
sourceOfFunds.purpose: To create awareness for building sector practitioners, architects and planners including consultants and academic institution regarding design and Implementation of Energy Efficient Solar Buildings with integration of renewable sources of energy in built environment case studies to demonstrate integration of solar photovoltaic solar thermal and solar passive technologies into developing sustainable habitat

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
sourceOfFunds.purpose: On the historic day of the launch of Skill India campaign, Sharp developments organized the third national conference on Green energy based CSR interventions. Business Case for Sustainable CSR INTERVENTIONS. The Conference was supported by the Ministry of New and Renewable Energy (MNRE), Government of India, and Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA). Indian Institute of Corporate Affairs (IICA) was the knowledge partner.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
sourceOfFunds.purpose: The conference had participation from architects, planners, developers, vendors and Government institutions like DDA, MCD, EDMC; MOEF, HUDA, BSES, CPWD and institutional organizations which helped constructive dialogue towards identifying a collaborative approach in making our cities Green and eventually Smart cities. It served as a platform to discuss the existing guidelines; strategy for promotion of renewable energy, waste management, and energy efficiency interventions at the city level.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Panchayati Raj Department Departmental Rural Development
sourceOfFunds.purpose: Since starting of the Panchayati Raj system in 1947 especially after the 73rd constitutional amendment in 1993 it has been felt that capacities of the PRIs members should be build and increased. In this regarding Ministry of Panchayati Raj and Rural development has initiated to build the capacities of the PRI members and plan facilitator at the community level. It was mandatory in 73rd amendment that Panchayat also will develop their plan and execute at their level.

The main emphasis of this project was to promote literacy to the women from the marginalized communities. The following objectives of the project have been conceived: 1 To promote women’s (especially women from marginalised communities) literacy and numeracy programmes that enable and strengthen: empowerment processes: • women’s livelihood; • women’s group and its leadership; • women’s participation in panchayats and school management committees (SMCs)
